rules: Rule1: If the factory produces the drug, then the drug requires approval.
Rule2: Either the factory produces the drug or the plant operates normally.
Rule3: Whenever an issue is reported to the supervisor, the incident is investigated by the team.
Rule4: In case the batch is contaminated with the substance, it is shipped to customers.
Rule5: Either the batch is contaminated with the substance or, if the plant is not operating normally, then the material is stored properly.
Rule6: Should the batch be quarantined at the facility, then it is not shipped to customers.
Rule7: The batch is quarantined at the facility or it is tested thoroughly.
Rule8: Assuming the batch is tested thoroughly, it is destroyed safely.
Rule9: Provided that the drug requires approval, it is not approved by the agency.
Rule10: In case the batch is destroyed safely, then it is not shipped to customers.
Rule11: If the company is profitable in the quarter, then it is expanding its operations.
Rule12: Should the company be profitable in the quarter, then it is not expanding its operations.
Rule13: Assuming the facility is compliant with regulations, the company is not fined by the regulator.
Rule14: Provided that the facility is audited annually, it is compliant with regulations.
Rule15: Either the facility is audited annually or it is inspected regularly.
Rule16: If the facility is inspected regularly, then it is certified to the standard.
Rule17: In case the facility is certified to the standard, it is compliant with regulations.
Rule18: Provided that the compound is stable in the formulation, the ingredient is pure in quality.
Rule19: Assuming the ingredient is pure in quality, the drug is safe for patients.

Rule20: Provided that the process is documented accurately, then if it is not the case that the container being labeled correctly implies that the plant not operating normally leads to the material being stored properly, then the product is not mispackaged due to error.
Rule21: Either the process is documented accurately or the record is verified by the manager.

Rule22: If the record is verified by the manager, then, should it not be the case that the container being labeled correctly implies that the plant not operating normally results in the material being stored properly, then the product is not mispackaged due to error.
Rule23: In case the drug is rejected by the agency, then it is approved by the agency.
Rule24: Either the chemical is available in the supply or, if the drug requires approval, then it is rejected by the agency.
Rule25: Provided that the machine operates properly, the plant operates normally.
Rule26: The machine operates properly or the equipment is maintained regularly.
Rule27: If the worker follows the protocol, then, assuming the equipment is maintained regularly, the plant operates normally.
Rule28: Either the worker follows the protocol or the worker is trained properly.
Rule29: Should the worker be trained properly, then, provided that the equipment is maintained regularly, the plant operates normally.
Rule30: In case it is not the case that the drug requiring approval implies it is rejected by the agency, then the company is profitable in the quarter.

Rule31: Provided that it is not the case that the container being labeled correctly implies that the plant not operating normally leads to the material being stored properly, then the product is mispackaged due to error.
Rule32: Assuming it is not the case that the equipment being maintained regularly implies the plant operates normally, then the company is fined by the regulator.

Rule33: Should it not be the case that the drug not being effective for treatment implies it is safe for patients results in the drug being recalled from the market, then the issue is reported to the supervisor.
Rule34: Provided that the plant is not operating normally, the drug is effective for treatment.
Rule35: In case the plant is not operating normally, the compound is stable in the formulation.
Rule36: Should the plant not be operating normally, then the drug is not safe for patients.
Rule37: Assuming the plant is not operating normally, the material is not stored properly.
facts: Fact1: The container is labeled correctly.
Fact2: It is not the case that the drug is recalled from the market.
Fact3: It is not the case that the incident is investigated by the team.
Fact4: It is not the case that the chemical is available in the supply.
